thread.title: Best Web videos: 'George Clooney Doesn't Need Words'
thread.title_full: Best Web videos: 'George Clooney Doesn't Need Words'

title: Best Web videos: 'George Clooney Doesn't Need Words'
text:
A new supercut from Burger Fiction compiles George Clooney's most telling facial expressions. (Photo: Merie Wallace, Fox Searchlight Pictures)
7 CONNECT 48 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Here's a recap of some of the best videos that graced the Internet this week. There's a George Clooney supercut, a documentary on mobile dating and an animated look at the future. Take a break from whatever you're doing and watch the five best videos of the week.
George Clooney Doesn't Need Words
Sometimes Clooney's handsome face speaks for itself. Burger Fiction compiles all the movie moments where the actor did not need dialogue to make a statement.
The Mobile Love Industry
"It's estimated that by 2040, 70% of all couples will have met online." VICE presents a 30-minute documentary exploring the ways mobile apps have radically changed dating.
Humans In 1000 Years
Over the last 150 years, the average human height has increased 10 cm and the global lifespan has increased nearly 20 years. The ASAP Science YouTube channel looks at what's in store for the next 1,000 years.
MORE: Web to Watch top picks
Up in Real Life
Warning: potential tears ahead. An elderly couple celebrates their 60th anniversary by recreating Carl and Ellie's theme from Pixar's Up .
Why is my voice different when I hear a recording?
Craig Benzine of the Mental Floss YouTube channel explains why you most likely hate the sound of your recorded voice.
7 CONNECT 48 TWEET LINKEDIN //usat.ly/1S1STku TOP VIDEOS
